 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007    
 HonorableApril Ford-Griffin,Alderwoman 5th Ward
           Resolution No. 272                   
         TO APPROVE THE 2008                    
     CATHEDRAL SQUARE SPECIAL                   
      BUSINESS DISTRICT BUDGET                  
      WHEREAS, Cathedral Square Special         
 Business District established by Ordinance     
 Number 63777, approved June 4, 1996 is         
 required under Section 7 thereof to file with  
 the Board of Aldermen its annual budget for    
 the funds collected by the Collector of        
 Revenue; and                                   
      WHEREAS,           the    Board    of     
 Commissioners of said District has met to      
 consider the budgetary requirements of the     
 Special Business District; and                 
      WHEREAS, said Board of                    
 Commissioners hereby submits the following     
 budget for the year beginning January 1, 2008  
 and ending December 31, 2008 for               
 consideration and approval by this Honorable   
 Board of Aldermen:                             
 CARRYOVER FROM 2006                  $ 1,000   
 INCOME                                         
Tax Revenue                        $ 97,000    
Interest                                500    
     Total Income                  $ 97,500    
EXPENSES                                       
Loan Payment               $36,500             
Security                   $54,000             
     Patrols                                   
     Security Cameras                          
     Traffic Island                            
     Cameras                                   
Snow Removal        $ 4,000                    
Light Cleaning      $ 1,000                    
Newsletter          $ 1,000                    
Insurance           $ 1,000                    
Miscellaneous $ 250                            
     Total Expenses                $ 97,750    
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                      
RESOLVED by this Honorable Board of            
Alderman that the aforesaid submitted budget   
is hereby approved.                            
Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007    
by:                                            
Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward    
          Resolution No. 273                   
        TO APPROVE THE 2008                    
    WASHINGTON PLACE SPECIAL                   
     BUSINESS DISTRICT BUDGET                  
     WHEREAS, Washington Place Special         
Business District established by Ordinance     
Number 63483, approved June 6, 1995 is         
required under Section 7 thereof to file with  
the Board of Aldermen its annual budget for    
the funds collected by the Collector of        
Revenue; and                                   
     WHEREAS,           the    Board    of     
Commissioners of said District has met to      
consider the budgetary requirements of the     
Special Business District; and                 
     WHEREAS, said Board of                    
Commissioners hereby submits the following     
budget for the year beginning January 1, 2008  
and ending December 31, 2008 for               
consideration and approval by this Honorable   
Board of Aldermen:                             
        ESTIMATED INCOME &                     
           CASH ON HAND                        
Tax Income 2007                      $ 30,000  
Income Carry-over from 2007            40,100  
     Total Income                    $ 70,100  
EXPENSES                                       
Board Approved Safety                          
Enhancements from 2006                         
to be completed       $20,000                  
Safety expenditures                            
 approved for 2008                                
 under view               $20,000                 
 High Tech Services       $20,500                 
 Insurance                $ 1,500                 
 Security Gate                                    
 Improvements             $ 5,000                 
 Reserves available                               
 for special needs        $ 3,600                 
      Total Expenses                   $70,100    
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by this Honorable Board of              
 Alderman that the aforesaid submitted budget     
 is hereby approved.                              
 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007      
 by:                                              
 Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward      
           Resolution No. 279                     
          JOHN BERENDZEN, AIA                     
       WHEREAS, The American Institute of         
 Architects celebrates its Sesquicentennial       
 Anniversary in 2007 and charges its members      
 to commit themselves to a meaningful legacy      
 project in their community in celebration of     
 this year; and                                   
       WHEREAS, 2007 AIA St. Louis                
 President John Berendzen approached the          
 Sesquicentennial legacy with gusto and viewed    
 the anniversary as a grand opportunity for       
 AIA St. Louis members to impact the greater      
 St. Louis community by undertaking a project     
 in The Historic Ville neighborhood; and          
       WHEREAS, under the leadership of           
 John Berendzen, The AIA St. Louis Chapter        
 selected The Ville Open Air Market legacy        
 project, a project that would inspire the        
 Chapter to collaborate with The Ville            
 neighborhood leadership, City of St. Louis       
 elected officials, City of St. Louis personnel,  
 Washington University School of Architecture,    
 Washington University School of Business,        
 St. Louis Produce Row, St. Louis Public          
 Schools, and The Ville Market Place Board of     
 Directors; and                                   
       WHEREAS, The Ville Market Place            
 project, under the leadership of John            
 Berendzen, has challenged the Chapter to grow    
 and stretch its good works and influence, and    
 yet remain humbled by their commitment to        
 better our City in the Ville neighborhood; and   
      WHEREAS, John Berendzen has                 
 displayed outstanding commitment to the St.      
 Louis Chapter of The American Institute of       
 Architects, The Institute, community             
 collaboration, and to the City of St. Louis.     
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis, that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize and congratulate      
 John Berendzen, AIA for his continuing efforts  
 to improve the quality of life for the residents
 of this City. We further direct the Clerk of    
 this Board to spread a copy of this Resolution  
 across the minutes of these proceedings and     
 prepare a commemorative copy for                
 presentation to our honoree at a time and place 
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007     
 by:                                             
 Honorable Lyda Krewson,Alderwoman 28th Ward     
           Resolution No. 280                    
         THOMAS FORTENBERRY                      
       WHEREAS, on December 10, 2007, the        
 17th Ward will hold its Annual Holiday Party    
 and Awards Ceremony at which time Thomas        
 Fortenberry and Darrell Grant will be honored   
 for their contributions to the 17th Ward and    
 the City of St. Louis; and                      
      WHEREAS, Thomas Fortenberry and            
 Darrell Grant have shown extraordinary          
 dedication and commitment to the Tiffany        
 neighborhood; and                               
      WHEREAS, Thomas Fortenberry and            
 Darrell Grant have lived in Tiffany since 2004  
 and are active members of the Tiffany           
 Community Association; and                      
      WHEREAS, Thomas Fortenberry and            
 Darrell Grant's contributions to the Tiffany    
 neighborhood include: neighborhood              
 covenants; a monthly newsletter; the yearly     
 National Night Out event; a back to school      
 barbecue; a major beautification project at     
 Lafayette and Grand; neighborhood trash         
 cleanups; curb repainting; Tiffany Park         
 plantings and cleanup; a full house rehab;      
 neighborhood watch programs; banners; and       
 an ongoing dedication to get more Tiffany       
 residents involved in the neighborhood;         
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize Thomas               
 Fortenberry and Darrell Grant as recipients     
 of the 17th Ward's Community Involvement        
 Award, and we further join with the members     
 of the 17th Ward in honoring their outstanding  
 contributions to our City, and we direct the    
 Clerk of the Board to spread a copy of this     
 Resolution across the minutes of this           
 proceeding and to prepare a commemorative       
 copy to be presented to our honoree at a time   
 and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.    
 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007     
 by:                                             
 Honorable Joseph D. Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward    
          Resolution No. 281                    
           MAGGY MALCOLM                        
      WHEREAS, on December 10, 2007, the        
17th Ward will hold its Annual Holiday Party    
and Awards Ceremony at which time Maggy         
Malcolm will be honored for her contributions   
to the 17th Ward and the City of St. Louis;     
and                                             
      WHEREAS, Maggy Malcolm has lived          
in the Central West End since 1991, has served  
as a commissioner on the Central West End       
South Special Business District for 13 years    
and as a member of the Central West End         
Association Marketing Committee and             
Membership Committee; and                       
      WHEREAS, Maggy Malcolm has been           
the driving force behind numerous successful    
efforts to improve and market the area,         
including the Central West End branding         
initiative, CWE brochures, wayfinders and       
signage;                                        
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
deliberations to recognize Maggy Malcolm as     
recipient of the 17th Ward's Community          
Involvement Award and we further join with      
the members of the 17th Ward in honoring        
Maggy Malcolm for her outstanding               
contributions to our City, and we direct the    
Clerk of the Board to spread a copy of this     
Resolution across the minutes of this           
proceeding and to prepare a commemorative       
copy to be presented to our honoree at a time   
and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.    
Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007     
by:                                             
Honorable Joseph D. Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward    
          Resolution No. 283                    
        JENNIFER MYERSCOUGH                     
      WHEREAS, on December 10, 2007, the        
17th Ward will hold its Annual Holiday Party    
and Awards Ceremony at which time Jennifer      
Myerscough will be honored for her              
contributions to the 17th Ward and the City     
of St. Louis; and                               
     WHEREAS, Jennifer Myerscough has           
shown extraordinary dedication and              
commitment to the Botanical Heights             
neighborhood; and                               
     WHEREAS, Jennifer Myerscough has           
lived in Botanical Heights since 2005, has      
served as president of the Botanical Heights    
Neighborhood Association for the last year      
and a half and as a board member for the        
Garden District Commission for two years;       
and                                             
     WHEREAS, Jennifer Myerscough has           
 organized a number of projects designed to       
 beautify the area and bring neighbors together,  
 including Operation Brightside, monthly          
 neighborhood cleanups, Botanical Lights and      
 community gardens;                               
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
 deliberations to recognize Jennifer              
 Myerscough as recipient of the 17th Ward's       
 Community Involvement Award, and we              
 further join with the members of the 17th Ward   
 in honoring Jennifer Myerscough for her          
 outstanding contributions to our City, and we    
 direct the Clerk of the Board to spread a copy   
 of this Resolution across the minutes of this    
 proceeding and to prepare a commemorative        
 copy to be presented to our honoree at a time    
 and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.     
 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007      
 by:                                              
 Honorable Joseph D. Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward     
           Resolution No. 284                     
            PETE ROTHSCHILD                       
       WHEREAS, on December 10, 2007, the         
 17th Ward will hold its Annual Holiday Party     
 and Awards Ceremony at which time Pete           
 Rothschild and Jeff Winzerling will be honored   
 for their contributions to the 17th Ward and     
 the City of St. Louis; and                       
      WHEREAS, Pete Rothschild and Jeff           
 Winzerling have shown extraordinary              
 dedication and commitment to the Central         
 West End; and                                    
       WHEREAS, Pete Rothschild and Jeff          
 Winzerling partnered to develop the Catlin       
 Townhomes, a seven-unit residential project      
 at the corner of West Pine and Boyle; and        
      WHEREAS, Pete Rothschild has been           
 investing in the Central West End and            
 throughout the city of St. Louis since 1969;     
 and                                              
       WHEREAS, Jeff Winzerling is president      
 of Universatile Development, which               
 concentrates on urban redevelopment projects     
 that benefit the city;                           
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                         
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of             
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our       
 deliberations to recognize Pete Rothschild and   
 Jeff Winzerling as recipients of the 17th        
 Ward's Community Involvement Award and           
 we further join with the members of the 17th     
 Ward in honoring their outstanding               
 contributions to our City, and we direct the     
 Clerk of the Board to spread a copy of this      
 Resolution across the minutes of this            
 proceeding and to prepare a commemorative        
 copy to be presented to our honoree at a time    
 and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.  
 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007   
 by:                                           
 Honorable Joseph D. Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward  
           Resolution No. 285                  
             JEFF WINZERLING                   
       WHEREAS, on December 10, 2007, the      
 17th Ward will hold its Annual Holiday Party  
 and Awards Ceremony at which time Pete        
 Rothschild and Jeff Winzerling will be honored
 for their contributions to the 17th Ward and  
 the City of St. Louis; and                    
      WHEREAS, Pete Rothschild and Jeff        
 Winzerling have shown extraordinary           
 dedication and commitment to the Central      
 West End; and                                 
       WHEREAS, Pete Rothschild and Jeff       
 Winzerling partnered to develop the Catlin    
 Townhomes, a seven-unit residential project   
 at the corner of West Pine and Boyle; and     
      WHEREAS, Pete Rothschild has been        
 investing in the Central West End and         
 throughout the city of St. Louis since 1969;  
 and                                           
       WHEREAS, Jeff Winzerling is president   
 of Universatile Development, which            
 concentrates on urban redevelopment projects  
 that benefit the city;                        
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                      
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of          
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our    
 deliberations to recognize Pete Rothschild and
 Jeff Winzerling as recipients of the 17th     
 Ward's Community Involvement Award and        
 we further join with the members of the 17th  
 Ward in honoring their outstanding            
 contributions to our City, and we direct the  
 Clerk of the Board to spread a copy of this   
 Resolution across the minutes of this         
 proceeding and to prepare a commemorative     
 copy to be presented to our honoree at a time 
 and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.  
 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007   
 by:                                           
 Honorable Joseph D. Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward  
           Resolution No. 286                  
              RALPH WAFER                      
      WHEREAS, on December 10, 2007, the       
 17th Ward will hold its Annual Holiday Party  
 and Awards Ceremony at which time Ralph       
 Wafer will be honored for his contributions to
 the 17th Ward and the City of St. Louis; and  
      WHEREAS, Ralph Wafer has shown           
 extraordinary dedication and commitment to    
 the Central West End neighborhood; and        
      WHEREAS, Ralph Wafer has lived in        
the Central West End since the mid-1970s,         
and has been a member of the Board of             
Directors of Central West End Midtown             
Development since 2005, serving as chair of       
the Infrastructure Committee; and                 
      WHEREAS, as chair of the                    
Infrastructure Committee, Ralph Wafer has         
worked tirelessly to improve infrastructure       
in the Central West End Midtown area,             
including: overseeing the redesign of the Euclid  
streetscape; sidewalk replacement and repair;     
installation of cut-off light fixtures; and the   
selection of a pedestrian light fixture for the   
neighborhood;                                     
     NOW THEREFORE BE IT                          
RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of              
the City of St. Louis that we pause in our        
deliberations to recognize Ralph Wafer as         
recipient of the 17th Ward's Community            
Involvement Award and we further join with        
the members of the 17th Ward in honoring          
Ralph Wafer for his outstanding contributions     
to our City, and we direct the Clerk of the       
Board to spread a copy of this Resolution         
across the minutes of this proceeding and to      
prepare a commemorative copy to be                
presented to our honoree at a time and place      
deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.                
Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007       
by:                                               
Honorable Joseph D. Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward      
          Resolution No. 287                      
            DARRELL GRANT                         
      WHEREAS, on December 10, 2007, the          
17th Ward will hold its Annual Holiday Party      
and Awards Ceremony at which time Thomas          
Fortenberry and Darrell Grant will be honored     
for their contributions to the 17th Ward and      
the City of St. Louis; and                        
     WHEREAS, Thomas Fortenberry and              
Darrell Grant have shown extraordinary            
dedication and commitment to the Tiffany          
neighborhood; and                                 
     WHEREAS, Thomas Fortenberry and              
Darrell Grant have lived in Tiffany since 2004    
and are active members of the Tiffany             
Community Association; and                        
     WHEREAS, Thomas Fortenberry and              
Darrell Grant's contributions to the Tiffany      
neighborhood include: neighborhood                
covenants; a monthly newsletter; the yearly       
National Night Out event; a back to school        
barbecue; a major beautification project at       
Lafayette and Grand; neighborhood trash           
cleanups; curb repainting; Tiffany Park           
plantings and cleanup; a full house rehab;        
neighborhood watch programs; banners; and         
an ongoing dedication to get more Tiffany         
residents involved in the neighborhood;           
       NOW THEREFORE BE IT                       
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize Thomas               
 Fortenberry and Darrell Grant as recipients     
 of the 17th Ward's Community Involvement        
 Award, and we further join with the members     
 of the 17th Ward in honoring their outstanding  
 contributions to our City, and we direct the    
 Clerk of the Board to spread a copy of this     
 Resolution across the minutes of this           
 proceeding and to prepare a commemorative       
 copy to be presented to our honoree at a time   
 and place deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.    
 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007     
 by:                                             
 Honorable Joseph D. Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward    
           Resolution No. 288                    
               JOE WORTH                         
       WHEREAS, on December 10, 2007, the        
 17th Ward will hold its Annual Holiday Party    
 and Awards Ceremony at which time Joe           
 Worth will be honored for his contributions     
 to the 17th Ward and the City of St. Louis;     
 and                                             
      WHEREAS, Joe Worth has shown               
 extraordinary dedication and commitment to      
 the Botanical Heights neighborhood; and         
      WHEREAS, Joe Worth has lived in            
 Botanical Heights since 2005 and serves on      
 the board of the Botanical Heights              
 Neighborhood Association and the Garden         
 District Commission; and                        
       WHEREAS, Joe Worth has helped             
 coordinate several community projects, serves   
 as a block captain, works tirelessly to bridge  
 the gap between new and existing residents,     
 and continues to make strides towards           
 building a cohesive and reputable community     
 called Botanical Heights.                       
      NOW THEREFORE BE IT                        
 RESOLVED by the Board of Aldermen of            
 the City of St. Louis that we pause in our      
 deliberations to recognize Joe Worth as         
 recipient of the 17th Ward's Community          
 Involvement Award, and we further join with     
 the members of the 17th Ward in honoring        
 Mr. Worth for his outstanding contributions     
 to our City, and we direct the Clerk of the     
 Board to spread a copy of this Resolution       
 across the minutes of this proceeding and to    
 prepare a commemorative copy to be              
 presented to our honoree at a time and place    
 deemed appropriate by the Sponsor.              
 Introduced on the 7th day of December, 2007     
 by:                                             
 Honorable Joseph D. Roddy,Alderman 17th Ward    
      Unanimous consent having been              
 obtained, Resolutions No. 248 - 273, 279 -   
 281 and 283 - 288 stood considered.          
       Ms. Young moved that Resolutions No.   
 248 - 273, 279 - 281 and 283 - 288 be adopted
 at this meeting of the Board.                
      Seconded by Mr. Conway.                 
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.      
          FIRST READING OF                    
            RESOLUTIONS                       
      None.                                   
           SECOND READING                     
           OF RESOLUTIONS                     
      None.                                   
       MISCELLANEOUS AND                      
       UNFINISHED BUSINESS                    
      Mr. Roddy moved to suspend the rules    
 and place Resolution No. 288 on the Courtesy 
 Resolutions Consent Calendar.                
      Seconded by Mr. Conway.                 
      Carried by the following vote:          
      Ayes: Flowers, Bosley, Moore, Griffin,  
 Triplett, Young, Conway, Ortmann, Villa,     
 Heitert, Wessels, Gregali, Florida, Baringer,
 Roddy, Kennedy, Davis, Schmid, Jones-King,   
 Boyd, Hanrahan, Waterhouse, Kirner,          
 Williamson, Carter and President Reed. 26    
      Noes: 0                                 
      Mr. Roddy moved to adopt Resolution     
 No. 288.                                     
      Seconded by Mr. Conway.                 
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.      
           ANNOUNCEMENTS                      
      None.                                   
         EXCUSED ALDERMEN                     
      Mr. Wessels moved to excuse the         
 following aldermen due to her necessary      
 absence: Ms. Krewson.                        
      Seconded by Mr. Heitert.                
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.      
              ADJOURNMENT                     
       Mr. Wessels moved to adjourn under     
 rules to return December 14, 2007.           
      Seconded by Mr. Villa.                  
      Carried unanimously by voice vote.      
      Respectfully submitted,                 
      Denise Watson-Wesley Coleman            
      Clerk, Board of Aldermen                
          BOARD OF                                
PUBLIC SERVICE                                    
         REGULAR MEETING                          
 St. Louis, MO - December 11, 2007                
     Board met at 1:45 P.M.                       
     Present: Directors Greco, Waelterman,        
Siedhoff and Rice-Walker.                         
     Absent: Directors Bess, Bryson and           
President Melton. (excused)                       
     Request of the Director of Parks,            
Recreation and Forestry, the Director of Public   
Safety and the President, Board of Public         
Service to be excused from the Regular Meeting    
of December 11, 2007 was read and leave of        
absence granted.                                  
      All actions pertaining to the Director of   
Parks, Recreation and Forestry, Public Safety     
and the President, Board of Public Service shall  
be the Special Order of the Day by the Board.     
     In the absence of the President, Board       
of Public Service, the Director of Health and     
Hospitals was appointed President pro tem.        
     Minutes of the Regular Meeting of            
December 4, 2007 were unanimously                 
approved.                                         
                LETTINGS                          
     Five sealed proposals for the public         
work advertised under Letting No. 8348 -          
Carondelet Recreation Complex (one on the         
blue form for insulated concrete forms) and       
(four on the white form for non-insulated         
concrete forms) was received, publicly            
opened, read and referred to the President.       
      Communications, reports, recommenda-        
tions and documents were submitted by Board       
Members and action thereon taken as follows:      
               PRESIDENT                          
     Proposed contract and bond ordered           
approved as follows:                              
     Letting No. 8344 - Delmar Median and         
Streetscape,   R.V. Wagner, Inc., 4712 Green      
Park Road, St. Louis, MO 63123, Contract          
No. 19705.                                        
     Supplemental Agreement No. 8 to P.S.A.       
No. 920 with PBTS (A Joint Venture) for           
General Grading Area A - Lambert St. Louis        
International Airport(R) Expansion Program        
approved and President authorized to execute      
same.                                             
     Supplemental Agreement No. 3 to P.S.A.       
No. 999 with ERM Technologies, Inc., for          
Primary Pumping Facility Automation for           
City of St. Louis Water Division approved         
and President authorized to execute same.

      Application No. 113543, Mr. and Mrs.       
 Thomas L. Coffman, encroach with fence          
 immediately south of and adjacent to 1411       
 Timberwood Lane on City of St. Louis Water      
 Division right-of-way ordered approved,         
 subject to certain conditions.

       UTILITIES AND STREETS

 follows: 113450, place cable in underground     
 conduit system at 4164 Kettler, 113451,         
 boring a 200 pair cable starting at 3129

 by trenching and/or boring at 115 Lemay and,    
 113457, boring at 4106 West Belle.

 University, directional bore interduct at 5176  
 Pershing ordered approved, subject to certain   
 conditions.

  UTILITIES AND PUBLIC SAFETY

 approved, subject to certain conditions as

 in C.B. 5311 and, 113503, Benton Historic       
 Homes, Inc., 3239-41 Indiana in C.B. 1521.

 approved, subject to certain conditions as

 27 Chippewa in C.B. 6124, 113515, Thomas        
 & Kristan Delgado, 4147 Chippewa in C.B.        
 5341.

 McCreery, subdivide at 3024-26 Geyer            
 ordered approved, subject to certain            
 conditions.

 No. 6690 ordered approved.

 Petition No. 6691 ordered approved.

 d/b/a AmerenUE, replace existing anchor with    
 new anchor on east side of Esther, south of     
 Wilson ordered approved, subject to certain     
 conditions.                                     
      DIRECTOR OF PARKS,                         
   RECREATION AND FORESTRY

 approved and Secretary instructed to forward    
 same to the Board of Aldermen with the          
 recommendation that it be passed:

 Board of Estimate and Apportionment and         
 the Board of Public Service, approving the      
 assignment by American Golf Corporation of        
 its lease of golf facilities in Forest Park to    
 CNL Income EAGL Leasehold Golf LLC, and

 to Evergreen Alliance Golf Limited, L.P.,         
 subject to the execution and delivery of certain  
 documents; authorizing the execution and          
 delivery of certain documents; with an            
 emergency provision."                             
  DIRECTORS OF HEALTH AND

 December 11, 2007 ordered approved.

 2007.                                             
                  Pamela Rice-Walker               
                  President pro tem                
 ATTEST:                                           
                  Cherise D. Thomas                
                  Secretary                        
             Office of the                         
        Board of Public Service                    
           City of St. Louis                       
       SEALED PROPOSALS will be received           
 for the Public Work hereinafter mentioned by      
 the Board of Public Service, 1200 Market          
 Street, Room 208 City Hall, until 1:45 P.M.,      
 St. Louis, Missouri time on JANUARY 15,           
 2008 at which time they will be publicly          
 opened and read, viz:                             
 JOB TITLE: DELOR AVENUE RECON-                    
 STRUCTION RIDGEWOOD TO                            
 MORGANFORD                                        
 LETTING NO.: 8349                                 
DEPOSIT: $20,800.00                                
     Drawings, Specifications and Form of          
Contract may be examined at the Office of the      
President of the Board of Public Service,          
Room 301 City Hall. Plans and specs may be         
viewed on BPS website: http://www.stl-             
bps.org/contract.asp (BPS Virtual Plan Room).      
     Sets of Drawings, Specifications and          
Proposal Form may be obtained by giving            
three (3) days notice, and upon payment of         
SEVENTY FIVE dollars ($75.00) for each             
set.                                               
     Purchased sets become the property of         
the prospective bidder and no refunds will         
be made.                                           
      Proposals must be made on blank forms        
to be furnished by the President of the Board      
of Public Service, and must be submitted to        
Room 208 City Hall.                                
      Each bidder shall specify in his proposal    
in figures, without interlineations, alterations,  
or erasures, a unit price for each of those items  
where so called for in the proposal, and shall     
show the products of the respective unit prices    
and estimated quantities. He shall also show       
in figures bid proposals for all items on which    
Lump Sum figures are requested, and, in            
addition thereto, at the end of the bid the Lump   
Sum for which he will perform all of the           
estimated work, as requested by the general        
requirements and covenants, specifications,        
and plans.                                         
     In case of a discrepancy between the          
gross sum shown in the proposal and that           
obtained by the addition of the bid prices as      
applied to the basic items, the latter shall       
prevail.                                           
     Each bid must be accompanied by a             
Cashier's or Treasurer's Check of a Bank or        
Trust Company in the City of Saint Louis,          
payable to the Order of the City Treasurer, or     
a Surety Bond approved by the Comptroller,         
for the amount of Deposit required, as             
heretofore stated.                                 
      All work under this contract will be paid    
for in cash, based on monthly estimates of the     
work completed, less a retained amount of          
ten (10%) percent. Final payment, including        
all retained percentages, will be made within      
ten (10) days after completion of all work and     
final acceptance by the City.                      
      The City of St. Louis will affirmatively     
insure that in any contract entered into           
pursuant to this advertisement, minority           
business enterprises will be afforded full         
opportunity to submit bids in response to          
this invitation and will not be discriminated      
against on the grounds of race, color or national  
origin in consideration for an award. The          
 M/WBE goal for this project is 25% and 5%.        
       The Contract shall provide that not less    
 than the prevailing hourly rate of wages in the   
 City of St. Louis as determined by the            
 Department of Labor and Industrial Relations      
 of the State of Missouri for each craft or type   
 of workmen needed in the actual construction      
 work on the site of the construction job herein   
 authorized, as well as the general prevailing     
 rate for legal holiday and overtime work shall    
 be paid to all workmen.                           
      All labor to be performed under this         
 contract shall be subject to the provisions of    
 Section 290.210 to 290.340, inclusive, of the     
 Revised Statutes of Missouri.                     
       The right of the Board of Public Service    
 to reject any or all bids is expressly reserved.  
     By Order of the Board of Public Service,      
 December 4, 2007.                                 
                  Marjorie L. Melton, P.E.         
                  President                        
 ATTEST:                                           
                  Cherise D. Thomas                
                  Secretary                        
  PUBLIC NOTICE                                    
       CITY OF ST. LOUIS                           
    BOARD OF PUBLIC SERVICE                        
       REQUEST FOR QUALIFICATIONS                  
 to provide PROFESSIONAL SERVICES                  
 FOR DESIGN OF MAIN TERMINAL                       
 TICKETING HALL AND MID-LEVEL                      
 ARCHITECTURAL RENOVATIONS at                      
 LAMBERT-ST. LOUIS INTERNATIONAL                   
 AIRPORT(R). Statements of Qualifications are      
 due by 5:00 pm (CST) December 21, 2007            
 at the City of St. Louis Board of Public Service  
 (BPS), 1200 Market Street, Room 301 City          
 Hall, St. Louis, MO 63103. The RFQ may be         
 obtained from the website www.stlbps.org          
 under Contracts & Bids, Professional Services;    
 by pick up from BPS at the address listed         
 above; or by calling Bette Behan at 314-589-      
 6214. An M/WBE participation goal of              
 25%/5% has been established for this project.     
  PUBLIC NOTICE                                    
       CITY OF ST. LOUIS                           
    BOARD OF PUBLIC SERVICE                        
      REQUEST FOR QUALIFICATIONS                   
 to provide PROFESSIONAL SERVICES                  
 FOR DESIGN OF MAIN TERMINAL                       
 TICKETING HALL and MID-LEVEL                      
 MECHANICAL, ELECTRICAL, PLUMB-                    
 ING, AND SPECIAL SYSTEMS (MEPSS)                  
 RENOVATIONS at LAMBERT-ST. LOUIS                
 INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT(R). Statements            
 of Qualifications are due by 5:00 pm (CST)      
 December 21, 2007 at the City of St. Louis      
 Board of Public Service (BPS), 1200 Market      
 Street, Room 301 City Hall, St. Louis, MO       
 63103. The RFQ may be obtained from the         
 website www.stlbps.org under Contracts &        
 Bids, Professional Services; by pick up from    
 BPS at the address listed above; or by calling  
 Bette Behan at 314-589-6214. An M/WBE           
 participation goal of 25%/5% has been           
 established for this project.                   
  PUBLIC NOTICE                                  
      A public hearing will be held by the       
 Board of Adjustment at 1:30 p.m. on             
 Wednesday, December 19, 2007, in Room           
 208 City Hall to consider the following:        
       APPEAL #8959-Appeal filed by Piros        
 Sign Company, from the determination of the     
 Building Commissioner in the denial of a        
 building permit authorizing the Appellant to    
 install one (1) ground sign as per plans at 2121
 Sulphur. WARD 24 #AB416970-07 ZONE:             
 "H" - Area Commercial District                  
      APPEAL #8960-Appeal filed by The           
 Charles Motor Company, LLC, from the            
 determination of the Building Commissioner      
 in the denial of an occupancy permit            
 authorizing the Appellant to operate an office/ 
 inside storage only of a private car collection 
 at 5701 Southwest. WARD 10 #AO415815-           
 07 ZONE: "A" - Single Family welling            
 District                                        
      APPEAL #8961-Appeal filed by               
 Benjamin Sims, from the determination of the    
 Building Commissioner in the denial of a        
 building permit authorizing the Appellant to    
 complete alterations for multiple family        
 dwelling units per plans at 7024 Pennsylvania.  
 WARD 11 #AB413663-07 ZONE: "B" -                
 Two Family Dwelling District                    
       APPEAL #8962-Appeal filed by James        
 Engineering & Surveying Company, from the       
 determination of the Board of Public Service    
 in the denial of a building permit authorizing  
 the Appellant to subdivide two parcels of land  
 in C.B.4058B at 5528-32 Southwest. WARD         
 10 #BPS113414 ZONE: "B" - Two                   
 Family Dwelling District                        
       APPEAL #8963-Appeal filed by              
 Suzanne Sibley, from the determination of the   
 Building Commissioner in the denial of a        
 building permit authorizing the Appellant to    
 operate consignment shop of arts and crafts     
 at 6980 Hancock. WARD 23 #AO416514-07           
 ZONE: "A" - Single Family Dwelling              
 District                                        
      APPEAL #8964 - Appeal filed by              
Anthony Robinson, from the determination          
of the Building Commissioner in the denial of     
a building permit authorizing the Appellant       
to construct a studio/garage per plans at 5075    
Delmar. WARD 18 #AB415714-07 ZONE:                
"H" - Area Commercial District                    
     APPEAL #8965 - Appeal filed by               
SMMM, LLC, from the determination of the          
Building Commissioner in the denial of a          
building permit authorizing the Appellant to      
convert three (3) family to six (6) multi family  
units (zoning only) at 225-229 W. Steins.         
WARD 11 #AB414953-07 ZONE: "B" -                  
Two Family Dwelling District                      
     APPEAL #8966 - Appeal filed by               
SMMM, LLC, from the determination of the          
Building Commissioner in the denial of a          
building permit authorizing the Appellant to      
convert commercial to multi family (zoning        
only) at 7501 Michigan. WARD 11                   
#AB414949-07 ZONE: "F" - Neighbor-                
hood Commercial District                          
     In accordance with the provisions of         
Ordinance 59981, effective July 31, 1986.         
    By authority of the Board of                  
Adjustment.                                       
     S. Cunningham, Chairman                      
 PUBLIC NOTICE                                    
    The Housing, Urban Development and            
Zoning Committee of the St. Louis Board of        
Aldermen will hold a Public Hearing on            
January 9, 2008 at 10:00 A.M. in the              
Kennedy Room (208) in City Hall:                  
        BOARD BILL NO. 388                        
           Introduced By                          
      Alderman Joseph Roddy                       
      An Ordinance recommended by the             
Planning Commission on November 7, 2007,          
to change the zoning of property as indicated     
on the District Map, from "J" Industrial          
District to "F" Neighborhood Commercial           
District, in City Block 4807 (4455 Chouteau),     
so as to include the described tract of land in   
City Block 4807; and containing an emergency      
clause.                                           
        BOARD BILL NO. 389                        
           Introduced By                          
      Alderman Joseph Roddy                       
     An Ordinance recommended by the              
Planning Commission on November 7, 2007,          
to change the zoning of property as indicated     
on the District Map, from "C" Multiple-           
Family Dwelling District to "F" Neighborhood      
Commercial District, in City Block 5197           
(4308, 4310 & 4312 McRee Avenue), so as to        
include the described tracts of land in City      
 Block 5197; and containing an emergency         
 clause.                                         
        BOARD BILL NO. 390                       
           Introduced By                         
       Alderman Ken Ortmann                      
       An Ordinance recommended by the           
 Planning Commission on November 7, 2007,        
 to change the zoning of property as indicated   
 on the District Map, from "J" Industrial        
 District to "H" Area Commercial District, in    
 City Block 1540 (3411 S. Broadway), so as       
 to include the described tract of land in City  
 Block 1540; and containing an emergency         
 clause.                                         
      Any person wishing to speak for or         
 against the above cited board bills should be   
 present.                                        
  PUBLIC NOTICE                                  
         CITY OF ST. LOUIS                       
        LAMBERT-ST. LOUIS                        
     INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT(R)                    
   SOLICITATION FOR BIDS FOR                     
 A/C CHILLER MAINTENANCE AND                     
        REPAIR SERVICES                          
    SEALED BIDS WANTED                           
      Sealed Bids will be received at Lambert    
 International Airport(R), Airport Properties    
 Department, Main Terminal, 10701                
 Lambert International Boulevard, St.            
 Louis, Missouri 63145 until 2:00 p.m.           
 Wednesday, January 16, 2008 at which time       
 they will be publicly opened and read in the    
 Airport Director's Conference Room. An          
 optional Pre- Bid Meeting and tour will be      
 held Friday, January 4, 2008 at 10:00am in      
 the Airport Director's Conference Room in       
 the Main Terminal of Lambert- St. Louis         
 International Airport(R).                       
      Bidding documents may be obtained at       
 the Airport Properties Department, Monday       
 through Friday between the hours of 8:30 a.m.   
 and 5:00 p.m., or by calling (314) 551-5020.    
 This Solicitation For Bids may be               
 obtained by visiting our website at             
 www.lambert-stlouis.com (click on "Business     
 Opportunities").                                
      The City of St. Louis encourages MBE/      
 WBE participation to the greatest extent        
 possible. More information is available at      
 www.mwdbe.org.                                  
 LIVING WAGE: "This solicitation is subject      
 to the St. Louis Living Wage Ordinance 65597    
 and the Regulations associated therewith."      
      Robert C. Salarano                         
      Contracts Administration Manager           
 DEPARTMENT OF                                           
  PERSONNEL                                              
      NOTICE OF EXAMINATIONS                             
      The City of St. Louis, Department of               
 Personnel, 1114 Market Street, Room 700,                
 announces competitive Civil Service                     
 examinations to fill vacancies in the Municipal         
 Service.                                                
       The last date for filing an application for       
 the following examinations is DECEMBER                  
 28, 2007.                                               
    ACCOUNTING COORDINATOR                               
             Prom./O.C. 1438                             
 $45,188 to $67,834 (Annual Salary Range)                
 HUMAN RELATIONS SPECIALIST                              
             Prom./O.C. 1437                             
 $34,164 to $51,298 (Annual Salary Range)                
      Application period for the following               
 examinations will close when enough                     
 applications are received to fill the anticipated       
 vacancies. Please submit application as soon            
 as possible.                                            
              EPIDEMIOLOGIST                             
            Prom./O.C.C. 1435                            
 $52,000 to $77,974 (Annual Salary Range)                
  TRUCK TIRE SERVICE WORKER                              
                 Prom./O.C.C. 1436                       
  $23,842 to $35,750 (Annual Salary Range)               
 ________________________________________________________
       Vacations, Holidays, Sick Leave, Social           
 Security, and Employee Retirement System                
 Benefits privileges are provided in addition to         
 salary.                                                 
       Application forms and further                     
 information concerning duties of positions,             
 desirable and necessary qualifications, relative        
 weights of examination components, and                  
 duration of eligible lists may be secured at the        
 office of the Department of Personnel, 1114             
 Market Street, Room 700, St. Louis MO                   
 63101. Applications can be submitted on the             
 Internet. Visit the city web site at                    
 www.stlouiscity.com and link to Jobs with               
 the City.                                               
                  Richard R. Frank                       
                  Director                               
 December 12, 2007                                       
 NOTICE TO ALL BIDDERS                                   
      CITY ORDINANCE requires that any                   
 individual or company who performs work                 
 within the City limits must obtain a Business           
License. This would also apply to businesses     
who employ sales or delivery personnel to        
come into the City. Contracts requiring work     
to be performed in the City will NOT be          
awarded to unlicensed businesses.                
Please contact the License Collector,            
Room 104 City Hall, St. Louis, Missouri,         
63103 or phone (314) 622-4528. You may           
also refer to our on-line site at                
www.stlouiscity.com.                             
ST. LOUIS LIVING                                 
WAGE ORDINANCE                                   
  LIVING WAGE REQUIREMENTS                       
Bidders [Proponents] are hereby advised that     
the St. Louis Living Wage Ordinance #65597       
and associated Regulations apply to the          
service [concession] [lease] [City Financial     
Assistance] for which [bids] [proposals] are     
being sought herein. This Ordinance requires     
that, unless specific exemptions apply, all      
individuals who perform work pursuant to a       
contract executed between the successful         
[bidder] [proponent] and the City [Agency]       
must be paid a minimum of the applicable         
Living Wage rates set forth in the attached      
Living Wage Bulletin, and, if the rates are      
adjusted during the term of the contract         
pursuant to the Ordinance, applicable rates      
after such adjustment is made. Each bidder       
[proponent] must submit the attached "Living     
Wage Acknowledgment and Acceptance               
Declaration" with the bid [proposal]. Failure    
to submit this Declaration with the bid          
[proposal] will result in rejection of the bid   
[proposal]. A successful bidder 's               
[proponent's] failure to comply with contract    
provisions related to the Living Wage            
Ordinance may result in termination of the       
contract and the imposition of additional        
penalties as set forth in the Ordinance and      
Regulations.                                     
     Copies of the Ordinance and Regulations     
are available upon request from La Queta         
Russell-Taylor, at (314) 551-5048, or can be     
accessed at http://www.mwdbe.org/living          
wage.                                            
   SUPPLY                                        
COMMISSIONER                                     
Office of the Supply Commissioner,               
Room 324, City Hall, 1200 Market Street,         
St. Louis, Missouri 63103, Tuesday,              
December 18, 2007 - ADVERTISED BIDS              
will be received by the undersigned to be        
opened at the office at 12:00 o'clock noon, for  
the items listed below on the dates specified.   
       Notice to All Suppliers                   
       NOTE: It is the policy of the City of       
 St. Louis that all firms desiring to do business  
 with the City of St. Louis must comply with       
 employment practices that are in accordance       
 with the ordinances of the City of St. Louis      
 and the Mayor's Executive Order promulgated       
 there-under to the end that all Contractors       
 and suppliers of materials and services will      
 offer equal opportunity for employment and        
 job advancement to blacks and other minority      
 groups in the St. Louis Metropolitan area.        
             Requesting a Bid                      
 To have a bid mailed or faxed to you, please      
 contact the Supply Commissioner's office at       
 (314) 622-4580.                                   
     TUESDAY, JANUARY 8, 2008

 1330.                                             
       Bidders are invited to be present at the    
 opening of bids. Bid results may be available     
 30 days following the date of bid opening.        
 If you desire bid results, please include a       
 self-address, stamped envelope with your bid.     
      The City of St. Louis desires to             
 purchase recycled products whenever               
 possible, especially items containing post        
 consumer waste materials. If your company         
 can supply recycled products, please provide      
 information to this office.                       
      The right to reject any and all bids is
 reserved.                                   
                Freddie L. Dunlap            
                Supply Commissioner          
                (314) 622-4580               
                www.stlouis.missouri.org
